message.content:
Reinforcement Learning, Probabilistic Methods, Theory. 

Reinforcement learning is the main focus of the paper, as the authors propose and analyze a new learning algorithm for partially observable Markov decision problems. 

Probabilistic methods are also present, as the algorithm operates in the space of stochastic policies, which can yield a policy that performs considerably better than any deterministic policy. 

Finally, the paper also belongs to the Theory sub-category, as it discusses the theoretical analysis of reinforcement learning algorithms in Markov environments and proposes a new algorithm for non-Markov decision problems.
